noun.description: A series of events that are regularly repeated in the same order.
examples: the boom and slump periods of a trade cycle
the painting is one of a cycle of seven
she cycled to work every day

verb.description: Move in or follow a regularly repeated sequence of events.
examples: economies cycle regularly between boom and slump

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin cyclus, from Greek kuklos circle.
